description: Single and two storey side to rear extension, Alterations to roof to raise ridge height, Rear dormer, Rooflights in front and side roof slopes, External alterations
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;">Location Plan; P202; P301; P302; P401; P402; Arboricultural Report; Reasonable Exception Statement</span>
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.

<p style="margin-bottom:0cm; margin-left:8.8pt; margin-right:0cm; margin-top:0cm; padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt"><span style="line-height: normal;"><span style="height: 5.45pt;">No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted, destroyed, pruned, cut or damaged in any manner during the development phase and thereafter within 5 years from the date of occupation of the building for its permitted use, other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars or as may be permitted by prior approval in writing from the local planning authority.</span></span></p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0cm; margin-left:8.8pt; margin-right:0cm; margin-top:0cm; padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt"><span style="line-height: normal;"><span style="height: 5.45pt;">The Arboricultural Method Statement (John Cromar, report ref. S1023-J1-IA-1 – AMS (Section 9, pg. 8) and Tree Protection Plan (S1023-J1-P1-V1 and S1023–J1-P1-V2 – John Cromar report 12/06/2023) submitted in support of the application shall be adhered to in full, subject to the pre-arranged tree protection monitoring and site supervision, detailed in Section 9, pages 8 - 10 of the report) by the appointed tree specialist. At site possession, the tree protection measures applicable to the works, as detailed in this report will be inspected by the arboriculturist and signed off if compliant. An initial inspection will take place (to check tree protection barriers / ground protection are in place); a monthly inspection will take place routinely; unannounced site inspections may also be carried out. All reports on site visits to be copied to the LPA within 5 days of site visit (photographs or reports can be emailed to <a data-cke-saved-href="mailto:rebecca.farrar@harrow.gov.uk" href="mailto:rebecca.farrar@harrow.gov.uk" style="">rebecca.farrar@harrow.gov.uk</a>)</span></span></p>
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
